Oral history is the oldest form of preserving history, but it hasn't always been given the recognition it deserves.   It can be messy, emotional but according to Dr. Foulis "in its essence it is human."

"Oral history is about documenting someone's recollection of a particular moment, event, or life history. For those who do the work, it is often more. It is a collective experience of coming together to share stories, receive them, and learn from them." - Dr. Foulis
"What is oral history? Oral history is the exchange of stories between an interviewer and an individual. Oral history helps the Latinx population take ownership of their own stories." - Dr. Foulis
